noun.description: A supporter of (the policies of) William Pitt the Elder, or his son, William Pitt the Younger.

adjective.description: Of or relating to (the policies of) William Pitt the Elder, or his son William Pitt the Younger.

origin: Early 19th century; earliest use found in James Beresford (1764–1840), writer. From pit + -ite, probably originally with humorous allusion to Pittite.
